title: THREE things you need to know this week (weekly ended 04/04/2023)

content.rendered:
Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu

Sharing some Investing and Economic insights:

THREE things you need to know this week;

  1. OPEC+ surprises markets by cutting output target
    • The group announced that it is cutting its production target by a further 1.16 million barrels per day (bpd) from May until the end of the year, bringing the total volume of cuts to 3.66 million bpd.
    • Oil prices surged on Monday trading close to USD85 per barrel – about 6% increase from approximately USD80 per barrel last Friday.

 

  1. Phase 2 of Sumbangan Tunai Rahmah (STR) to be distributed starting 5 April
    • The payment, which involves a total sum of RM1.26 billion, will be credited into stages to 8.7 million beneficiaries from the B40 group with household income of less than RM2,500.
    • 4 million recipients from the household category will receive RM200, whereas 1.2 million senior citizens and 3.5 million singles will receive RM100.

 

  1. EPF members may apply for personal financing from banking institutions from 7 April
    • Eligible members who are aged 40 and above may apply using their Account 2 balance as a support for their loans to tide through difficult times. The maximum financing amount has been fixed at RM50,000 with a repayment tenure of up to 10 years.
    • This facility is targeted towards EPF members who have savings of at least RM3,000 in their Account 2, as they are “supported with a reasonable income to ensure they can afford the financing and repay it without compromising their retirement income adequacy and security”.

 

Raiz is about helping you save & invest more – being able to save 5% of your salary is better than earning 5% return. Having a disciplined savings habit can help improve your financial position quicker (than spending time choosing the best fund manager).

 

Do you know?

OPEC+

OPEC+ is a group of 23 oil-exporting countries that meets regularly to decide how much crude oil to sell on the world market. Cumulatively, the group produces about 40% of all the world’s crude oil.

title: Prestasi Pegangan Portfolio Raiz – bagi Februari 2023

content.rendered:
Click here for English

28-03-2023

Prestasi portfolio Raiz untuk 12 bulan lepas

(28/02/2022 – 28/02/2023)

Sumber: ASNB, abrdn, UOBAM, AHAM.

 

Adakah anda menggunakan Portfolio Bolehubah (Custom Portfolio)?

Prestasi portfolio hanyalah pulangan wajaran gabungan setiap dana yang telah anda pilih untuk berada dalam portfolio bolehubah anda.

Sebagai contoh, anda memperuntukkan;

    1. 20% pelaburan anda dalam dana sukuk; dan
    2. 30% dalam dana ekuiti global islamik; dan
    3. 50% dalam dana emas shariah.

 

Prestasi tahunan dana adalah (anda boleh lihat di atas);

    1. Dana Sukuk: +3.2% vs penanda aras +3.0%
    2. Dana Ekuiti Dunia Islam: -4.6% vs penanda aras +1.2%
    3. Dana Emas Syariah: 0.0% vs penanda aras +1.7%

Pulangan portfolio tahunannya ialah [(+3.2% x 20%) + (-4.6% x 30%) + (0.0% x 50%)] = -0.7%.

Penanda aras tahunannya ialah [(+3.0% x 20%) + (+1.2% x 30%) + (+1.7% x 50%)] = +1.8%.

 

Sekejap… penanda aras tu apa?

Penanda aras adalah nilai indikatif keuntungan pelaburan anda yang sepatutnya. Ia adalah untuk anda membandingkan pulangan pelaburan anda (yang sebenari!) berbanding penanda arasnya.

Harap kami membantu pemahaman anda untuk melabur dengan lebih pintar.

 

Kami ingin mengingatkan prestasi masa lalu bukanlah petunjuk yang baik untuk menentukan prestasi masa hadapan.

Falsafah pelaburan Raiz adalah melabur, walaupun dengan jumlah yang kecil, secara berkala untuk mengekalkan momentum.

Mempunyai disiplin menyimpan wang secara berkala adalah lebih baik dalam membantu meningkatkan kedudukan kewangan anda dalam jangka masa panjang daripada kesibukan memilih pengurus dana yang terbaik.

Maklumat Penting

Maklumat di laman web ini adalah nasihat umum sahaja. Ini bermakna ia tidak mempertimbangkan objektif pelaburan, keadaan kewangan atau keperluan pelaburan seseorang.

Sekiranya anda seorang pelabur, anda harus berjumpa dengan penasihat berlesen anda sebelum menggunakan apa-apa maklumat yang terdapat dalam artikel ini untuk memahami sepenuhnya manfaat dan risiko yang berkaitan dengan produk Raiz.

Maklumat di laman web ini adalah sulit. Ia tidak boleh diterbitkan semula, diedarkan atau didedahkan kepada orang lain. Maklumat tersebut berdasarkan andaian atau keadaan pasaran yang berubah tanpa notis. Ini akan mempengaruhi ketepatan maklumat.

Dalam apa jua keadaan maklumat yang akan digunakan oleh, atau disampaikan kepada, seseorang untuk tujuan membuat keputusan mengenai pelaburan di Raiz, prestasi pulangan masa lalu produk Raiz tidak boleh dijadikan panduan semasa membuat keputusan untuk melabur dalam Raiz dan bukan peramal prestasi masa depan yang baik.

title: Performance of Raiz Portfolio Holdings – for February 2023

content.rendered:
Klik sini untuk Bahasa Melayu

28-03-2023

Past 12-month change in the value for Raiz portfolios

(28/02/2022 – 28/02/2023)

Source: ASNB, abrdn, UOBAM, AHAM.

 

Are you on Custom Portfolio?

The portfolio performance is simply the combined weightage return of each fund you have chosen to be in your custom portfolio.

For example, you allocated;

    1. 20% of your investment in sukuk fund; and
    2. 30% in Islamic world equity fund; and
    3. 50% in shariah gold fund.

 

The yearly performance of the funds are (you can see from above);

    1. Sukuk fund: +3.2% vs benchmark +3.0%
    2. Islamic world equity fund: -4.6% vs benchmark +1.2%
    3. shariah gold fund: 0.0% vs benchmark +1.7%

 

Its yearly portfolio return is [(+3.2% x 20%) + (-4.6% x 30%) + (+0.0% x 50%)] = -0.7%.

Its yearly benchmark is [(+3.0% x 20%) + (+1.2% x 30%) + (+1.7% x 50%)] = +1.8%.

 

But wait… what is benchmark?

Benchmark is an indicative value of how much your investment should have performed. It is for you to compare your investment return (in reality!) vs its benchmark.

Hope that helps your understanding in investing smart.

 

Keep in mind that past performance is not a good indicator of future performance.

The Raiz philosophy is about saving and investing, even with small amounts, regularly so you can keep the momentum going.

Being able to save 5% of your salary is better than earning 5% return. Having a disciplined savings habit can help improve your financial position quicker than spending time choosing the best fund manager.

The most historic banking marriage since 2008 between Switzerland’s two big banks. UBS agreed to take over its long-time rival Credit Suisse for USD 3.2 billion – marking the biggest banking deal in years.

p/s from as much as USD 96 billion to just USD 3 billion, this means that UBS got a whopping discount!

Regulators were eager to halt a dangerous decline in confidence in the global banking system. Swiss authorities had to change the country’s laws as they rushed to finalize the deal. The Swiss government will also provide more than USD 9 billion to support losses that UBS may incur by the takeover. The Swiss National Bank also provided more than USD 100 billion of liquidity to UBS to help facilitate the deal.

The speedy orchestration of this “forced marriage” engineered by the Swiss authorities just shows how bad the situation is.

However, stocks rallied yesterday (after huge drop last week) as investors breathed a sigh of relief that a historic weekend rescue of the financial heavyweight has potentially stopped the banking crisis contagion – for now.
